items.item: More than 100.000 people work at Deutsche Bank.
More than 22% new colleagues in just 5 years: that is how fast Deutsche is growing.
73 countries are home to Deutschbankers today. In 1970 it was just 19 countries.
38% of us work in the German home market.
62% of us work in countries outside Germany.
8,110 Deutschbankers work in the U.K. – 10% of our entire workforce.
In the U.S. there are 10,800 Deutschbankers – 13% of our entire workforce.
13,588 Deutschbankers are based in Europe – 17% of all staff.
In Asia we have 15,943 employees – they represent 20% of all Deutschbankers.
In just 5 years the number of our employees in Asia has doubled.
12% of us work outside their home country.
9,000 Deutschbankers work in Frankfurt – 11% of all staff.
We are located in 16 buildings and branches in Frankfurt alone.
2,800 Deutschbankers work at the Frankfurt Head Office.
7,197 of us have their offices in New York. Deutsche is the only bank on Wall Street.
6,246 people work for Deutsche in London, making us the largest employer in the City of London.
In Hong Kong there are 1,365 Deutschbankers.
139 nations – that is how diverse we are at Deutsche.
43% of all Deutschbankers are women.
25% of us are under 30 years of age, and 14% are over 50.
1,600 trainees start their career at Deutsche in Germany every year.
We invest nearly €100,000,000 every year in education, social projects, art and music.
21% of all Deutschbankers have done Corporate Volunteer work.
More than 1,200 Deutschbankers every year teach school children on money matters.
226.516 citizens in the U.K. benefited from Deutsche’s educational and social projects in 2010.
We raised £1,700,000 for our British “Charity of the Year” in the last year.
€86,000,000 are invested every year by Deutsche Bank in training projects for employees.
5 Deutschbankers have won Olympic medals.
1,300 new colleagues at the Dutch ABN Amro became Deutschbankers.
19% of us take advantage of the bank’s flexible part-time working models.
A 250m area was planted with trees by 160 Deutsche trainees in 2010.
Deutsche had 60,000 applicants for 1,000 graduate trainee positions.
204 of us have won Deutsche’s Management Award for Excellence so far.
6,000 visitors enjoy tours of our global Art Collection every year.
